meanings.definition: To frighten or cause fear in someone.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm affrayered the little dog.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie affrayered the audience.
meanings.sent3: The prankster affrayered his friends by jumping out from behind a door.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence affrayered her more than any loud noise.
meanings.sent5: The sudden scream in the dark affrayered everyone at the campfire.

meanings.definition: A person who causes fear or alarm in others.
meanings.sent1: The haunted house was full of affrayers waiting to scare visitors.
meanings.sent2: The masked figure in the alley turned out to be an affrayer playing a Halloween prank.
meanings.sent3: The little boy dressed as a ghost was the cutest affrayer at the costume party.
meanings.sent4: She saw him as an affrayer, but he was just a shy guy trying to make friends.
meanings.sent5: The horror movie actress was known as the ultimate affrayer on screen.
